manifest.name: cel
manifest.title: CEL Custom API
manifest.description: Collect custom events from an API with Elastic agent

policy_templates.name: cel
policy_templates.title: CEL Custom API Input
policy_templates.description: Collect custom data from HTTP and file-system APIs.

vars.name: data_stream.dataset
vars.description: Dataset to write data to. Changing the dataset will send the data to a different index. You can't use `-` in the name of a dataset and only valid characters for [Elasticsearch index names](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/docs-index_.html).
vars.title: Dataset name

vars.name: pipeline
vars.description: The Ingest Node pipeline ID to be used by the integration.
vars.title: Ingest Pipeline

vars.name: resource_url
vars.description: i.e. scheme://host:port/path
vars.title: Resource URL

vars.name: resource_interval
vars.description: How often the API is polled, supports seconds, minutes and hours.
vars.title: Resource Interval

vars.name: program
vars.default:
# // Fetch the agent's public IP every minute and note when the last request was made.
# // It does not use the Resource URL configuration value.
# bytes(get("https://api.ipify.org/?format=json").Body).as(body, {
#     "events": [body.decode_json().with({
#         "last_requested_at": has(state.cursor) && has(state.cursor.last_requested_at) ?
#             state.cursor.last_requested_at
#         :
#             now
#     })],
#     "cursor": {"last_requested_at": now}
# })
vars.description:
Program is the CEL program that is executed each polling period to get and transform the API data.
More information can be found in the [documentation](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/beats/filebeat/current/filebeat-input-cel.html#_execution).
vars.title: The CEL program to be run for each polling.

vars.name: state
vars.description:
State is the initial state to be provided to the program. If it has a cursor field, that field will be overwritten by any stored cursor, but will be available if no stored cursor exists.
More information can be found in the [documentation](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/beats/filebeat/current/filebeat-input-cel.html#input-state-cel).
vars.title: Initial CEL evaluation state

vars.name: regexp
vars.description:
Regexps is the set of regular expression to be made available to the program by name. The syntax used is [RE2](https://github.com/google/re2/wiki/Syntax).
More information can be found in the [documentation](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/beats/filebeat/current/filebeat-input-cel.html#regexp-cel).
vars.title: Defined Regular Expressions

vars.name: username
vars.description: The username to be used with Basic Auth headers
vars.title: Basic Auth Username

vars.name: password
vars.description: The password to be used with Basic Auth headers
vars.title: Basic Auth Password

vars.name: oauth_id
vars.description: Client ID used for Oauth2 authentication
vars.title: Oauth2 Client ID

vars.name: oauth_secret
vars.description: Client secret used for Oauth2 authentication
vars.title: Oauth2 Client Secret

vars.name: oauth_token_url
vars.description: The URL endpoint that will be used to generate the tokens during the oauth2 flow. It is required if no oauth_custom variable is set or provider is not specified in oauth_custom variable.
vars.title: Oauth2 Token URL

vars.name: resource_ssl
vars.description: i.e. certificate_authorities, supported_protocols, verification_mode etc, more examples found in the [documentation](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/beats/filebeat/current/configuration-ssl.html#ssl-common-config)
vars.title: Resource SSL Configuration

vars.name: resource_timeout
vars.description: Duration before declaring that the HTTP client connection has timed out. Valid time units are ns, us, ms, s, m, h. Default is "30"s.
vars.title: Resource Timeout

vars.name: resource_proxy_url
vars.description: This specifies proxy configuration in the form of `http[s]://<user>:<password>@<server name/ip>:<port>`.
vars.title: Resource Proxy

vars.name: resource_retry_max_attempts
vars.description: The maximum number of retries for the HTTP client. Default is "5".
vars.title: Resource Retry Max Attempts

vars.name: resource_retry_wait_min
vars.description: The minimum time to wait before a retry is attempted. Default is "1s".
vars.title: Resource Retry Wait Min

vars.name: resource_retry_wait_max
vars.description: The maximum time to wait before a retry is attempted. Default is "60s".
vars.title: Resource Retry Wait Max

vars.name: resource_redirect_forward_headers
vars.description: When set to true resource headers are forwarded in case of a redirect. Default is "false".
vars.title: Resource Redirect Forward Headers

vars.name: resource_redirect_headers_ban_list
vars.description: When Redirect Forward Headers is set to true, all headers except the ones defined in this list will be forwarded. All headers are forwarded by default.
vars.title: Resource Redirect Headers Ban List

vars.name: resource_redirect_max_redirects
vars.description: The maximum number of redirects to follow for a resource. Default is "10".
vars.title: Resource Redirect Max Redirects

vars.name: resource_rate_limit_limit
vars.description: The value of the response that specifies the total limit.
vars.title: Resource Rate Limit

vars.name: resource_rate_limit_burst
vars.description: The maximum burst size. Burst is the maximum number of resource requests that can be made above the overall rate limit.
vars.title: Resource Rate Limit Burst

vars.name: oauth_provider
vars.description: Used to configure supported oauth2 providers. Each supported provider will require specific settings. It is not set by default. Supported providers are "azure" and "google".
vars.title: Oauth2 Provider

vars.name: oauth_scopes
vars.description: A list of scopes that will be resourceed during the oauth2 flow. It is optional for all providers.
vars.title: Oauth2 Scopes

vars.name: oauth_google_credentials_file
vars.description: The full path to the credentials file for Google.
vars.title: Oauth2 Google Credentials File

vars.name: oauth_google_credentials_json
vars.description: Your Google credentials information as raw JSON.
vars.title: Oauth2 Google Credentials JSON

vars.name: oauth_google_jwt_file
vars.description: Full path to the JWT Account Key file for Google.
vars.title: Oauth2 Google JWT File

vars.name: oauth_google_jwt_json
vars.description: Your Google JWT information as raw JSON.
vars.title: Oauth2 Google JWT JSON

vars.name: oauth_google_delegated_account
vars.description: Email of the delegated account used to create the credentials (usually an admin).
vars.title: Oauth2 Google Delegated account

vars.name: oauth_azure_tenant_id
vars.description: Optional setting used for authentication when using Azure provider. Since it is used in the process to generate the token_url, it canâ€™t be used in combination with it.
vars.title: Oauth2 Azure Tenant ID

vars.name: oauth_azure_resource
vars.description: Optional setting for the accessed WebAPI resource when using azure provider.
vars.title: Oauth2 Azure Resource

vars.name: oauth_endpoint_params
vars.description: Set of values that will be sent on each resource to the token_url. Each param key can have multiple values. Can be set for all providers except google.
vars.title: Oauth2 Endpoint Params

vars.name: processors
vars.description: Processors are used to reduce the number of fields in the exported event or to enhance the event with metadata. This executes in the agent before the logs are parsed. See [Processors](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/beats/filebeat/current/filtering-and-enhancing-data.html) for details.
vars.title: Processors

vars.name: enable_request_tracer
vars.description: The request tracer logs HTTP requests and responses to the agent's local file-system for debugging configurations. Enabling this request tracing compromises security and should only be used for debugging. See [documentation](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/beats/filebeat/current/filebeat-input-cel.html#_resource_tracer_filename) for details.
vars.title: Enable request tracing

changes.description: Added build manifest to indicate the ECS reference.
